attributes.action: Make verified ID a requirement for accessing online pornography.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2019 the government shelved plans to protect children by forcing pornography websites to require proof of age before they grant access to adult content under the pretext that such a law would be unenforceable. 

Following a petition launched by Katie Price, the government will debate whether to 'make it a legal requirement when opening a new social media account to provide a verified form of ID.' 

If social media access can be regulated in this way, so can pornography access.
attributes.background:
If social media websites can be forced to require ID, so can pornography websites. The government needs to: 

- Remove clause 131 of the Online Safety Bill
- Enforce in its entirety part 3 of the Digital Economy Act 2017, forcing pornography websites to require age verification for access.

rejection.details:
